TextView.android:text: Model : SKYNAV N9040 Dual High Power
Transponder Frequency Test port: TRU’s TX FREQ. Test Eqpt: Freq counter
Interrogator Frequency Test port: MOU’s INT FREQ Test Eqpt: Freq counter
Identification test\n(This test puts the system out of operation. NOTAM may be required)
Ident freq during key down and proper Morse code sequence Test port: TRU’s TX GAU Test Eqpt: CRO & Freq Counter
i) Go to RMM > Configuration > Identification and set the mode to be continuous.\n (appearance of Ident pulses among the reply pulses with Morse Code audio. 1350 ± 25 ppps)
ii) The oscilloscope should display 1350 pps
Monitor Action \n(Transmitter will be on/off. The DME operation will be interrupted around 20 minutes for each DME. NOTAM may be required.)
From RMM > Configuration > System, set the System Delay to 50 ± 1μs
i) After 10s, the MOUs will declare an alarm, and cause a changeover.
ii) Then 10s later, the MOUs will declare an alarm, and cause a shutdown.
From RMM > Configuration > System, set pulse spacing to 12 ± 0.25μs
i) After 10s, the MOUs will declare an alarm, and cause a changeover.
ii) Then 10s later, the MOUs will declare an alarm, and cause a shutdown.
Output radiated within each 0.5MHz band centered at ± 0.8MHz from the nominal freq. is not more than 200Mw
Output radiated within each 0.5MHz band centered at ± 2MHz from the nominal freq. is not more than 2mW
Sensitivity Such that power density at antenna > -103dBW/m²
Sensitivity variation with load\n<1dB for loading between 0 & 90% of max. transmission rate
Bandwidth Such that sensitivity degrades < 3dB for interrogation freq. drift of ± 100KHz
Decoder No response to interrogations with pulse spacing more than 2µs from nominal
Interconnecting wire harness, coaxial cables & connectors

EditText.android:hint: Free from corrosion, breaks, cracks & burns.
